name: Chelyabinsk Meteor
description: A 20-meter near-Earth asteroid entered Earth's atmosphere over Russia. It exploded in an air burst 29.7 km (18.5 mi) above the ground. The explosion generated a shock wave that injured over 1,500 people and damaged 7,200 buildings.

name: Tunguska Event
description: The largest impact event on Earth in recorded history. A massive explosion flattened 2,000 square kilometers (770 sq mi) of forest. It is believed to have been caused by the air burst of a stony meteoroid about 50-60 meters in size.

name: Barringer Crater
description: Also known as Meteor Crater. It was formed by the impact of a nickel-iron meteorite about 50 meters (160 ft) across. The crater is about 1,200 m (3,900 ft) in diameter and 170 m (560 ft) deep.

name: Chicxulub Impactor
description: A massive asteroid or comet about 10 to 15 kilometers in diameter. The impact created the Chicxulub crater and triggered a mass extinction event that wiped out 75% of plant and animal species on Earth, including non-avian dinosaurs.

name: Vredefort Impactor
description: The largest verified impact crater on Earth. The asteroid is estimated to have been 10-15 km in diameter. The original crater was 300 km (190 mi) across.
